subclusters.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic polymorphisms regulating immune-inflammatory responses and chronic inflammation (inflammaging) as drivers of aging and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic control of immune responsiveness affecting lifespan and tumor incidence, linking immune genetics to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related immune remodeling driven by chronic antigen load and immunosenescence impacting age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights early-life infection and chronic inflammation as drivers of aging, with immunopathology linking immune activity to senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on immune regulation capacity, immune dysregulation, and chronic inflammation as determinants of aging and survival.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on genetic factors in immune system gene regulation influencing lifespan and disease susceptibility.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains evolutionary trade-offs involving inflammatory host response shaping life history and aging via genetic adaptations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details TLR4 polymorphisms modulating inflammatory responses and their impact on aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows altered immune gene expression and inflammation suppression in Ames dwarf mice delaying aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes sex-specific immunosenescence and chronic immune activation affecting parasite burden and health decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on immunosenescence, inflammaging, and their role in chronic inflammatory diseases with genetic background influence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Inflammatory Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates immunosenescence and inflammaging with genetic and epigenetic regulation affecting aging and disease susceptibility.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes thymic involution, decline in T cell function, and impaired immunoregulation as central to immune aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on thymic involution, T cell subset imbalance, and inflammation-mediated insulin resistance linking immune aging to diabetes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes neuroendocrine-immune axis disruption via thymic involution as a trigger for systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details inflammation-driven lamin-B1 reduction causing thymic epithelial cell senescence and thymic involution.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains asymmetric thymic involution causing clonal imbalance in T cell populations and increased autoimmunity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows early life adversity programs immune system towards pro-inflammatory senescence affecting T cell function and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes type 1 interferon-induced Foxo1 down-regulation causing T cell exhaustion and dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on thymic involution reducing naive T cells, oligoclonal expansions, and senescent T cell pro-inflammatory secretions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links immunosenescence, especially T cell decline, to increased parasite burden and mortality, emphasizing immune aging's causal role.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes early immune dysfunction, including thymic involution and T cell decline, as causal drivers of systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Dysfunction in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of senescent immune cells with telomere shortening and molecular defects impairing immune competence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chronic Viral Antigenic Stimulation and T Cell Exhaustion in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on persistent viral infections like CMV driving chronic antigenic stimulation, T cell differentiation, and immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Exercise-Enhanced Immune Competency and Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights exercise improving immune function, delaying immunosenescence, and enhancing vaccine responses across lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Cell Senescence and Systemic Aging Propagation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows DNA damage-induced immune cell senescence causally driving systemic aging via SASP and cell non-autonomous effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic and Post-Translational Regulation of Immunosenescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes epigenetic and post-translational modifications regulating immune cell aging, immunosenescence, and inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NLRP3 Inflammasome Activation and Inflammaging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details NLRP3 inflammasome activation by ROS driving cardiocyte aging and inflammatory cytokine release.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NLRP3 Inflammasome Activation and Inflammaging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes innate immune dysregulation with NF-κB/NLRP3 inflammasome vicious cycle driving inflammaging and mitochondrial impairment.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NLRP3 Inflammasome Activation and Inflammaging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metabolic regulation of NLRP3 inflammasome activation linking mitochondrial dysfunction to chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammation-Induced Endothelial and Tissue Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes chronic inflammation and ROS from leukocytes cause endothelial senescence and systemic aging via tissue damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammation-Resolution Imbalance via Lipid Mediators in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes imbalance between pro- and anti-inflammatory lipid mediators from arachidonic acid metabolism driving chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autoantibody Accumulation and Chronic Inflammation in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains antibody repertoire changes with age leading to autoantibody accumulation, chronic inflammation, and accelerated aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autoimmune and Neuroinflammatory Mechanisms in Immune Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links immune aging to increased autoimmunity and neuroinflammation contributing to Alzheimer's disease pathogenesis.
